subject: Problems migrating from JUnit3.7 to 3.8.1
msgSnippet: Hi all! I have an app w/JUnit suite of tests that I m trying to get back into and work on and I decided to update JUnit, before I do anything. I was running
messageBody:
Hi all!

I have an app w/JUnit suite of tests that I'm trying to
get back into and work on and I decided to update JUnit,
before I do anything. I was running JUnit3.7 and all the
tests passed.

I D/Led JUnit3.8.1, unzipped it, unzipped the src.zip,
and modified my CLASSPATH to point to this version. I
opened a new CMD prompt window and re-ran Ant. Isee
this error:

test:
[junit] java.lang.NoSuchMethodError
[junit] at
org.apache.tools.ant.taskdefs.optional.junit.PlainJUnitResult
Formatter.startTest(PlainJUnitResultFormatter.java:188)
[junit] at
junit.framework.TestResult.startTest(TestResult.java:151)
[junit] at junit.framework.TestResult.run(TestResult.java:103)
[junit] at junit.framework.TestCase.run(TestCase.java:118)
[junit] at junit.framework.TestSuite.runTest(TestSuite.java:208)
[junit] at junit.framework.TestSuite.run(TestSuite.java:203)
[junit] at
org.apache.tools.ant.taskdefs.optional.junit.JUnitTestRunner.
run(JUnitTestRunner.java:231)
[junit] at
org.apache.tools.ant.taskdefs.optional.junit.JUnitTestRunner.
main(JUnitTestRunner.java:409)
[junit] Exception in thread "main"

BUILD FAILED

Any suggestions?

I'm now running JUnit3.8.1, Ant 1.4, and JDK1.3 on Windows 2K.
Do I need to update Ant or the JDK? Do I need to change my
tests, Ant setup, or did I miss some step? It's been a while
since I played with this stuff.

Thanks in advance!

P.S. I can successfully run the JUnit3.8.1 tests.


PCM (Paul Michali)
